intro: Hemizonia scabrella, commonly known as the roughleaf hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Hemizonia scabrella is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks.
